name: Indonesia
takeaway: Under Joko Widodo (Jokowi)'s leadership, co-operation agreements between Indonesian media and Chinese media have increased considerably, with China using media in many countries including Indonesia to spread a positive image and disseminate pro-Beijing propaganda.

Foreign policy also plays an important role in supporting good relations between China and Indonesia. Jokowi has been in office for about a decade, over which time the direction of Indonesia's foreign policy has begun to lean towards Beijing, and is considered to be dependent on China.

The Economy Domain shows Indonesia has a fairly high dependence on China, which can be seen from the majority of infrastructure projects undertaken by China. China also plays a role in the majority of the nickel industry in Indonesia. China has become Indonesia's number one economic partner, especially in trade and investment.

The Indonesian military is ready to establish high-level communication and enhance pragmatic cooperation in various fields, including the exchange of visits by each other's naval ships, and providing mutual military support. The two countries also agreed to conduct routine joint military exercises.

Indonesia's position as country firmly opposed to all forms of oppression and colonialism all over the world is not visible in the Uyghur case, a stance which should be discussed at the mulitaleral level.
description-1: In 2023, Indonesia had a GDP per capita of US$4,941 and a total population of 280.03 million people.
description-2: Indonesia established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1950. Indonesia was ranked 111th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 57/100.

Media.evidence: The Ming Pao, Sin Chew Daily, China Press, Guang Ming Daily, and Nanyang Siang Pau are the five main news outlets that make up the World Chinese Media network. Only Sin Chew Daily has distributed articles all over the nation among these well-known periodicals. Indonesians were first introduced to magazine subscriptions by the Hong Kong newspaper Yazhou Zhoukan. Additionally, several media companies have partnered with entities that are a part of the World Chinese Media (Harian Indonesia). The Yinhua Daily News is a component of the global network of Chinese media. One of the most widely read Chinese newspapers in Indonesia is the Yinhua Daily News. However, its readership has been dwindling recently, which has diminished its influence.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In 2018 there was an agreement between the All-China Journalists' Association (ACJA) and the Association of Indonesian Journalists (PWI) to provide prizes for Indonesian journalists who write at BRI, which was seen as effective in encouraging local journalists to write pro-Beijing propaganda.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In February 2019, 11 journalists from Indonesia and Malaysia were invited to visit Xinjiang to see the Chinese government's policies against extremism. Not only that a senior editor of the Kompas newspaper named Nugroho Fery Yudho he praised China's efforts to fight extremism after visiting Xinjiang for the first time, noting that he saw no evidence of people being locked up, as reported by other media. In addition, in August 2019, 10 journalists from PWI were selected to travel to Beijing and other Chinese provinces. A senior journalist from Radar Lombok, wrote the article after a trip to China and said that foreign media had been spreading fake news about China and denied reports that China was corrupted by violence and coercion.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Zulfiani Lubis chief editor of Idntimes.com, an online publication targeting young Indonesians, noted that vocational training is a common way to fight terrorism, extremism, and separatism, and drew comparisons between Indonesia's and China's respective experiences in terrorism.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Articles from ChinaDaily and Xinhua have been reposted in Indonesian printing and online media such as Media Indonesia and the Jakarta Post. Videos from CCTV and other Chinese state media have also been reposted in Indonesia TV channels.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: PT China Sonangol Media Investment (CMSI), a joint venture between one of Indonesia's media magnate Surya Paloh's Media Group and PT China Sonangol Land, is the only company discovered to be partially controlled by a Chinese businessperson. However, the company ran into financial difficulties and was unable to pay its suppliers.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Articles from ChinaDaily and Xinhua have been reposted in Indonesian printing and online media such as Media Indonesia and the Jakarta Post. Videos from CCTV and other Chinese state media have also been reposted in Indonesia TV channels. These were done mostly through content-sharing agreements.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: We are unable to find any source which indicates it
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is some evidence that the Chinese state has sought to intimidate Indonesian journalists. Bayu Hermawan, a journalist for Republika, a national daily newspaper for Indonesia’s Muslim community, received a WhatsApp message from a Chinese embassy employee in Jakarta saying that an article he wrote about a 2019 Beijing-organized tour to Xinjiang contained errors and did not properly acknowledge the positive aspects of his trip. Hermawan had published articles citing camp residents in Xinjiang who said that they were not given trials or were brought in for offenses like adhering to a halal (Muslim law-compliant) diet.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Indonesian media occasionally uses emotive language in discussing Indonesia-PRC relations. For example, an ANTARA News article quotes Said Aqil Siradj emphasizing Indonesia-China collaboration and brotherhood for global benefit, illustrating emotive language usage.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In Indonesia there is a channel on the Youtube platform called "Assumption" with a sub-channel called "Cha Guan" which has very vocal content denying the existence of human rights violations in Xinjiang by the PRC. The majority of Cha Guan's posts contain propaganda and have been watched by hundreds of thousands of viewers, and received 1.32 million subscribers as of August 2023.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Indonesia publicly upholds one China principle in the Taiwan issue
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: As already explained in indicator 6 that Indonesia upholds the free and active policy, this is also implemented in the issues of China and Taiwan. However, in the context of the South China Sea issue, Indonesia is not empowered enough, perhaps because of its economic dependence on China, even when there is China Coast Guard activity approaching or even entering North Natuna waters, the Indonesian Navy only monitors it, even though based on UNCLOS, the area is Indonesian territory.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence:
In 2022 there were many critics of the Indonesian government rejecting a motion to discuss the Uyghur issue at the UN Human Rights Council. As a country that condemns imperialism and violence, Indonesia's credibility is questioned. Even though Indonesia is very vocal about voicing the Palestinian issue.

Not only that, Indonesia also deported Uighurs who were arrested in Indonesia even though the government already knew clearly the consequences of the punishments carried out on them when they were in the hands of the Chinese government. Instead of protecting the Indonesian government, they deported the 4 Uighurs on the pretext that they were connected to a network of extremist groups.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Indonesia does not want to intervene regarding Tibet. The Indonesian government believes that the Chinese government can solve the Tibetan problem.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Indonesia chose to remain silent on China's position in passing the National Security Law in Hong Kong. Indonesia chose not to vote during the 44th session of the UN Human Rights Council.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Alibaba and Huawei have cooperated with universities in Indonesia to encourage the digital economy in Indonesia.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
Indonesia is the second country with the most Confucius Institute Centers in ASEAN. There are at least 8 Confucius Institute Centers today. This development began in 2010 in line with the increasing public interest in Mandarin. Counfucius Institute can also be found in several tertiary institutions in Indonesia, for example at Al-Azhar Indonesia University in Jakarta, Muhammadiyah Malang University in East Java, Tanjungpura University in West Kalimantan, Maranatha Christian University in Bandung, and Surabaya State University in Surabaya.

China's soft power efforts through culture are quite accepted in Indonesia, one of which is with the Confucius Institute, although they do not have a large enough influence.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The Indonesian government does not include Mandarin as the national curriculum, but the regional government implements the Mandarin language curriculum. Therefore, in several regions of Indonesia there are special Mandarin subjects in several regions and provinces in Indonesia, for example in Jambi.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: According to Wang Zhen, PhD Candidate at the University of Albany, SUNY stated that there is Chinese involvement with think tanks across ASEAN. In the Indonesian context, the institution that is coordinating the involvement of Chinese think tanks in Indonesia is the Center for ASEAN Studies at Gadjah Mada University, Yogyakarta. It is understood that the think-tank has received funding from the Chinese government for capacity building and for the participation of its staff in short courses and workshops in China.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are Indonesian think tanks which participate quite frequently in activities with their Chinese counterparts such as the Habibie Center, the Center for Chinese Studies, and the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). CSIS Indonesia is also known to have received funding from China's National Institute for South China Sea Studies to conduct research on fisheries and peace in the South China Sea for the Chinese Embassy in Indonesia.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
China has attracted Indonesian students to study in their country through scholarships. As of 2019 there are 15,780 Indonesian students currently studying in China.

China also has a scholarship program that specifically targets the largest Islamic organization in Indonesia, namely Nahdlatul Ulama (NU). Students who are affiliated with NU get a special quota to continue their tertiary education in China for free. This scholarship is called the Santri scholarship. They are often invited to attend events organized by the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) such as the Xinjiang Brief Forum.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are scholars invited to take trips to have academic meetings, conferences or scholarly discussions. Those are interested to pursue higher degree are also offered scholarships to study in China. There are quite a number of scholarships provided by PRC government for Indonesians. As most Indonesian students would need financial assistance to study abroad, scholarships granted by the PRC government are attracting Indonesian students, making them flock to China. However, the scholarship provided by PRC government not yet publicly translated directly to positive attitude toward China.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Relations between Indonesia and China have thrived in multi-sectors, especially the economy and infrastructure, the cooperation that has been forged is also quite diverse from the central to the regional levels. Ridwan Kamil, governor of West Java, has signed a smartcity development collaboration with China, besides that, Ganjar Pranowo, Governor of Central Java, has also signed a development agreement in the Batang Industrial Area.

Society.evidence:
China's incessant efforts of Islamic diplomacy in Indonesia have pushed the country close to the largest Islamic organizations in Indonesia, namely Nadhlatul Ulama and Muhammadiyah. Officials from the Chinese Embassy frequently visit NU, especially during the month of Ramadan to donate around US$7,000 to the NU orphanage. In addition, in 2018 the Chinese embassy also funded the construction of sanitation facilities in villages dominated by NU in West Java.

It is also known that the donation of funds sent by the all-China women's federation for Indonesia.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence:
Apart from the proliferation of Korean dramas in Indonesia, Chinese dramas are no less in demand among the public. There has been collaboration between Indonesian television stations such as TVRI and China Media Group since 2018 to broadcast old Chinese dramas. Apart from that, the wide variety of drama types that can be accessed on iQiYi has made Indonesia the biggest enthusiast, thus encouraging collaboration between iQiYi and the MNC Group, which is a media company in Indonesia.

Apart from that, there is also the TV channel Hi-Indo! owned by Central Television (CCTV), which broadcasts in Indonesia, this channel also frequently displays films and programs in Mandarin with Indonesian subtitles which are quite attractive to Indonesians of Chinese descent.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Indonesia`s delegation was led by deputy minister of defense Sjafrie Sjamsoeddin while the Chinese delegation was led by PLA`s deputy chief of general staff Lieutenant General Qi Jian`guo.
